column4: Actually I am a kubuntu user but right now I am installing a Gnome software so I thought I would ask here. 'libbonobo2-common' and 'libbonobo2-0' both depend on each other what should I do ??
install them both with the same apt-get command
and gmcastil: I donot have net at home and hence I download packages on an XP box and take them home through pendrive?? Now what should I do
put all the packages you downloaded into one directory with nothing else in it, then   sudo dpkg -i *
and for the future, look into  apt-zip , it's designed to help with that
This is a differentt query. I f I have 2 packages with 1 depending on other in a folder and I use 'sudo dpkg -i *' will the dependencies get resolved
yes, dpkg will handle that fine. The * matches all files in that directory. If you have other ones, you can do  sudo dpkg -i  <deb1> <deb2>  by name
I cannot use apt-zip as the other box has WinXP on it.
I get all the dependencies as I have made a list of what all is installed on my pc and compare it while downloading dependencies
apt-zip creates a script that uses wget to download the files; easily translated to a msdos script
Could you come oftopic and please explain it in more detail as I am new user
it's been a few years since I used it, but sure
Please explain it as I am becoming crazy doing all this >>[ATI graphic card], [sound card not working with ALSA], [lastly its very difficult to install simple softwares
the bottom line for ubuntu is you really need internet for it to be useful
But i want to make it usable without internet
get it to the net, install the stuff you want, then disconnect
Immpossible as it is a not a laptop and moreover I don't have enough permissions at home  to move the box as I am young (17)
then you're kinda stuck, really. Linux is fundamentally a networked os
I do know what you're talking about, I lived at the bottom of a 3k pipe for over a year, it was excruciating even with that
I am extremely thankful for your help. I will look into apt-zip thing. Thanks
wweasel gmcastil has been very helpful to many already. Everyone has their bad moments
We are joking
